One way to understand is stability of NH3. || In example 1, the order is true only for Gaseous State
Another way to understand is that if there is more availibility of Lone Pair of Nitrogen then more Hydrogen are attracted and hence it is more basic.
In Aquous Solution, the 2o > 3o mainly because of Hydrogen bonding nad more dissolving (Hydration)
If the solvent is Benzene then it will be the same as in Gaseious State
Aromatic amines will get more preference than Non-aromatic ones

According to Ortho Effect, ortho substituted is less basic compared to its meta and para and also aniline.
